content: I want to do case analysis on a boolean expression, and I want to get the hypothesis "exp = true" for the true case and "exp = false" for the false case. Essentially I want what Coq's "destruct eqn:xxx" does. Is there an equivalent in Lean to achieve this?
You haven't supplied a #mwe but maybe cases exp is what you're looking for?

CJ said:

I want to do case analysis on a boolean expression, and I want to get the hypothesis "exp = true" for the true case and "exp = false" for the false case. Essentially I want what Coq's "destruct eqn:xxx" does. Is there an equivalent in Lean to achieve this?

by_cases eqn : xyz

Both of these work. With cases eqn : xyz you get case false in which eqn : xyz = false and case true in which eqn : xyz = true. With by_cases eqn : xyz you get case pos in which eqn : xyz = true and case neg in which eqn : ¬xyz = true.
i'm guessing cases is closer to Coq's "destruct", as it works for practically all inductives and structures. On the other hand, by_cases is specialized for (doing lem on) Prop
CJ asked for Boolean expressions which I presume meant Prop
